publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2974 Colin Fox: Welcome End to Slopping Out at HM Prison Edinburgh—That the Parliament welcomes the end of slopping out at HM Prison Edinburgh; further welcomes the opening of the Ingliston Houseblock on 1 June 2005 which means that 80 years of this filthy and degrading practice at Saughton, which has long been condemned by the European Court of Human Rights, is now at an end, and calls on the Scottish Executive to eradicate slopping out at the remaining facilities in the Scottish prisons estate at Polmont, Perth and Peterhead as soon as possible. Supported by: Shiona Baird*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Pringle*, Dr Jean Turner*
